summary: This document is an email chain from November-December 2021 between Assistant United States Attorneys regarding sharing Government Exhibits (specifically GX-332) related to the Maxwell case. It shows ongoing trial preparation and evidence sharing between prosecutors.

persons.name: Moe
persons.context: Appears as a recipient copied on an email from a U.S. Attorney regarding Government Exhibits for the Maxwell case.

connections.description: Both are involved in the Maxwell case document sharing process with U.S. Attorneys.

events.title: Government Exhibit GX-332 shared
events.description: An Assistant U.S. Attorney attaches Government Exhibit GX-332 for review regarding the Maxwell case.

events.title: Government Exhibit shared
events.description: An Assistant U.S. Attorney shares another Government Exhibit related to the Maxwell case.

events.title: Document sharing arrangement
events.description: An Assistant U.S. Attorney arranges for documents to be shared via USAfx system regarding the Maxwell case.

locations.name: United States Attorney's Office Southern District of New York
locations.address: One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007

keyFacts: Government Exhibit GX-332 is specifically referenced as evidence in the Maxwell case.
The email chain shows ongoing coordination between U.S. Attorneys in late 2021 regarding trial preparation for Ghislaine Maxwell's case.
The document sharing involves both direct email attachments and the USAfx document sharing system.
The correspondence originates from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.
Multiple Government Exhibits were being shared and discussed in the weeks leading up to Maxwell's trial.
